fields.description:
{panel:title=Update from Product team}
We are actively working on this feature, and will soon be looking for users to try it out.

If you work in an instance that relies on remote issue links, we would love to hear from you.

Please complete the following Google Form and we will be in-touch shortly.

[https://forms.gle/3zPygVX7dgnKkisX8]
{panel}
h3. Summary
 * After creating application link, one of the expected benefits of this feature is to be able to link Jira issues on your cloud site to the other cloud site.
 * Currently, the new issue view does not provide the old option to select the server and link to a Jira issue from another cloud site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an application link with another Jira cloud site.
 ** !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Try to link a Jira issue from your cloud site to the other cloud site.

h3. Expected Results
 * In the old issue view we used to have the option to select the server then link the issue from the other cloud site.
 ** !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
 * In the new issue view we don't have anymore the option to select the server.
 * We cannot link the issue from the other cloud site.
 ** !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes:
 * This video illustrates further the behavior: [^Recording #280.mp4]

h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view. For that follow the steps below:
{panel}
 # Select your avatar and choose Personal settings
 # Turn off the New Jira issue view toggle under Labs
 # Reload the page in order to see the classic view instead where this functionality exists{panel}
fields.summary: Not possible to remote link Jira issues using Application Links (AppLinks) in new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The JIRA Issue Development panel does not recover if the target application became unavailable (e.g. backup process, unexpected downtime, maintenance window, etc). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between JIRA Cloud and a Fisheye & Crucible server instance following the requirements on [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/link-to-server-apps-from-cloud-744721656.html].
# Commit something to your repository including a JIRA issue key in the commit message and wait for Fisheye to index the repository.
# After a few minutes the commit will show up as linked to the JIRA issue under the Development panel section.
# Create a backup of the Fisheye & Crucible Server instance (the application will remain unavailable until the backup completes) or shut it down for a few minutes.

h3. Expected Results
* Once Fisheye & Crucible is back up and running, the Development panel will re-establish the connection and display the linked commit.

h3. Actual Results
* The Development panel does not display the commit anymore, even after Fisheye & Crucible is available.
* From the JIRA {{Project settings >> Development tools}} page, there's a warning message displaying:
!connected-developer-tools.png|thumbnail!
And all of the capabilities from Fisheye & Crucible are unavailable.

h3.Workaround
# To recover from that and have the Development panel display the linked commit, it is necessary to refresh the connection settings inside the JIRA {{Project settings >> Development tools}} page.

(i) It is only necessary to refresh the connection settings in one JIRA project to re-establish the connection across all JIRA issues. There's no need to access each one of the projects to re-establish connection.
fields.summary: Development panel information does not recover after application maintenance window

fields.description:
Currently, Agility projects don't allow a user to set a field as mandatory or not. 
Would be a good approach for the agility projects if users could set a field as mandatory(validation) or optional.
fields.summary: Set a mandatory field in Agility projects

fields.description:
Please update the  documentation for the rest/api/latest/user/search to include examples on how to search for users and portal only customer using the email address since all the examples are still using the username that is going to be deprecated soon.

Not even the [REST API migration guide and deprecation notice - removal of username and userkey|[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/#examples]] is having clear examples showing that this can be achieved by using e.g. below Request:
 * [https://HOSTNAME/rest/api/latest/user/search?query=something@example.com|https://hostname/rest/api/latest/user/search?query=something@example.com]

 

The above REST API call will return, among the other things, the *accountId* for the user (or portal only customer) having the given email address (in this case: [something@example.com|https://hostname/rest/api/latest/user/search?query=something@example.com])
fields.summary: It should be documented how to get accountId for users and portal only customers using REST API now that the username is being removed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence you can search for a user in the sidebar, and clicking on the user in search result redirects you to the user profile in _People Directory_:
 !Confluence - Search.png|thumbnail! 

This however is not possible in JIRA and searching for user in the sidebar does not return any result:
 !JIRA - Search.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the ability to search for users in JIRA sidebar
fields.summary: Ability to search for a user in sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
You can choose a gadget for the dashboard for example Created vs. Resolved Chart. 

Today you may click on a point in the graph for a specific date and get a tooltip with the sum of all issues created vs. resolved that day.

However, we would also like to be able to see a list with these issues, similar to Search Issues (via "Issues and filters" in the left menu on the dashboard), with the possibility to work with them directly. This is sort of how it works if you go via project settings and select Reports, where you can click directly in the graph (although that list is not as good). 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to drilldown into individual tickets and data from the reports Gadget like actual reports.

h3. Workaround
View the report directly
fields.summary: Allow users to drilldown on Gadget reports data like actual reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Inactive and add-on users are not visible in the groups, however, the groups are visible while navigating to user's detail page from *User management* 

h3. Suggested Solution
Users in group should include both inactive and add-on users
fields.summary: Inactive and add-on users not visible in group

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a special character to an issue, it will still display the issue but won't allow any comments to be added and the transition issue looks like it fails but it actually does transition the issue.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 * Jira Server needs to be confirmed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any Jira Issue but add a special character on the end like a full stop - [https://testinstance.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-1.]
 # Comment on the issue

h3. Expected Results
 # Either the comment should be added to the issue
 # Or the issue shouldn't display when the URL contains special characters on the end
h3.  
h3. Actual Results

An error is shown when trying to comment as shown in the screenshot below:

  !communicationbreakdown.png|thumbnail!
{quote}
h2. Communications Breakdown
{quote}
{quote}The Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.

Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser
{quote}
 
h3. Why is this important?

I doubt that users will be adding characters like dollar signs after the issue URL, however; it's reasonable to believe that there are issue URL's being shared that contain a full stop at the end which is then added to the URL.

If the user is using Jira and types an issue with a full stop followed by pressing the space button ([https://test.atlassian.net/test-1.] ), Jira will include the full stop in the hyperlink. Now when a user clicks the link with the full stop and comments on an issue, they will encounter this bug.

This is how I discovered this bug by being sent a link with a full stop.
h3. Workaround

Remove special characters from the end of the issue URL
fields.summary: Adding a special character at the end of the Issue URL will still show the issue but will cause problems

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently all fields are showing on the side in the new JIRA issue view. This can lead to an extremely long list of fields. While we do have customers who prefers all the fields to be displayed, there are also customers who prefers empty fields to not be shown at all.

It will be nice if users are given a configuration that can control whether empty fields should be shown or hidden in the new JIRA issue view.
fields.summary: Give option to hide fields with no value in new JIRA issue view

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
 At the moment, the built-in Jira Cloud-Slack Integration does not allow multiple notifications from One Project to be created for the Same Slack Channel the way that HipChat does it.
 !Slack.png|thumbnail!

h3.*Suggested Solution*
 Add a feature which will allow administrators to configure or Add the same Slack Channel multiple times to the same JIRA Project, the same way its done on HipChat
 !hipchat.png|thumbnail!

h3.*Why this is important*
 This feature will help users who has multiple users who use the same Slack workspace and Project to notifications based on what they need.

h3.*Workaround*
 None at the Moment
fields.summary: Allow Multiple Notifications to be created for the Same Slack Channel

fields.description:
Hi,

Since a day ago some users that have set in the profile "New Jira issue view" in Lab section see the issues in a normal way with the new Jira view (what is very  incomplete yet ... admins can't order fields, no tabs , worse fisualization of text fields , no workflow view button etc etc)

 

We would like to have the possibility of activate the New Jira View only for  visualization of issues in Boards (Kanbam or Scrum boards) , but no in the general view as is activated now. If we disable in our  profile  the "New Jira issue view" , it is  disable in all the places (boards and normal view) 

Could you considerer it in cloud instances?
fields.summary: Ability to activate New Jira View only for view issues in boards

fields.description:
In the new Jira VIEW all the fields are shown on the same column (right column) 

There are serveral fields that are important to see always in the issue like "Type of issue", Priority" , "Component/s" , Affects Version/s, Fix Version/s Resolution and Labels.

 

Please reconsider to keep that fields in the top left-hand side as it's set now in old view at least for desktop Jira version.

It's very annoying to have to search important fields in the narrow rigth-side area (which is very narrow) in the new Jira issue view
fields.summary: New JIRA View . keep Important fields permanently on the left-hand side of issue view

fields.description:
all the fields are set in the right-hand side in the new Jira view .

To have Text fields (multi-line) in that location is a very bad decision.

These text fields sometimes have a lot of text and it's very hard for users to read in this new location. 

 

The current location (in the left panel ) is more clear to read these kind of text fields

 

Please, consider to move back these kind of customText fields (multi-line) fields to the left-hand side area (as in the old view) or to able a way to resize the right-hand side to be more width... or have the capability to resize this side .
fields.summary: New Jira Issues View - Change Text fields (multi-line) Location or resize right-hand side view

fields.description:
h2. Summary 
In the Business Board, fields with related to time - such as Original Estimate - don't show the time in hours, as per in the Time Tracking configuration.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Edit the Time Tracking global settings to "Hours" - both available configuration.
# Access the board of the business project.
# Open an issue in the board
# Observe that _Time Display Format_ and _Unit_ are changed to *Pretty* and *Minute*

h2. Expected Result
_Time Display Format_ and _Unit_ displayed in _Hours_ in the issue.

h2. Actual result
_Time Display Format_ and _Unit_ are changed still in _Pretty_ mode.


h2. Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Time is Not Displayed in Hours in a Business Board
The rest/api/3/user endpoint example is missing the parameter

fields.description:
One is unable to search for issues using the mobile app. This has been something that we wanted to be able to do countless times. Please add search functionalities to the mobile app, and at the same time also enhance the overall search functionality of Jira on the browser-based version as well.

At the moment, the browser only lists results when you type in keywords related to the task or ticket heading. There should be an option that allows the user to choose whether the results listed should be only for the task heading, task content, or both. This would have saved us hours of time trying to locate tasks and related content on our Kanban boards.

Finally, it would also be recommended if one can also perform a search based on the task or ticket number. Often times we have the ticket numbers, but struggle to find it on the Kanban board, unless you try and use the browser's text search functionality. When using the mobile app, there is, of course, no search functionality whatsoever.

These searches should be based upon selections of a broad match or an exact match.

 

Finla
fields.summary: Mobile App & Browser Based - Enhanced Search Features

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue created using API which returned an error (i.e: 400, 503) but the issue was created in Jira with missing workflow transitions.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud REST API

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send REST call to create Issue when the server is under heavy HTTP requests or partial outage.
# Check if the API returns an error while also creating the issue in Jira.

h3. Expected Results
The Issue should not be created as the API was not successful.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is created with inconsistencies like the workflow transitions missing.
h3. Notes
A high number of " PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS Exception already occurred in this workcontext, skipping next getConnection" errors occurred in during the same time.

h3. Workaround:
 * Reach out to [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#]
fields.summary: Workflow transitions missing in Issue

The gadget configurations appear

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Hide Menu's option gets disabled once we hover over a collapse navigation bar in Boards
By right, when we hover on a collapse navigation bar, it only shows as a preview of the menu rather than being expanded automatically.
However, when we choose the option "Hide Menus" in the Active sprint board.
Upon hovering over the navigation bar, the navigation bar gets automatically expanded and fixed.
This somehow will undo our Hide Menu option.

h3. Environment
* New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Active Sprint board, Collapse the left navigation bar.
# Choose the option “Hide Menus”. (The menu on the above will be hidden)
# Hover the mouse on the area of the left navigation bar. (It will show as a preview)


h3. Expected Results
It will only preview the navigation bar and gets collapsed again after the mouse is no longer hovering on the navigation bar.

h3. Actual Results
The navigation bar then becomes expanded automatically again (and does not get collapse again as intended) and the Hide Menu gets undo.

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Updated navigation bar - Hide Menu's gets disabled after hovering over a collapsed navigation bar in Boards

fields.description:
We have both Jira Server and Confluence Server.  It appears the ability to end a user's session from the admin console still doesn't exist in either product.

There are existing issues requesting the feature that have been created for both cloud and server that were closed as "won't fix" or "resolved".  Please consider this a request to reconsider.

I find it disappointing that somewhat obvious feature requirements in Atlassian's products are often not implemented from the start and/or ignored when requested.  I understand this feature exists if Crowd is implemented along side Jira and Confluence, but the ability to administratively end a user session should be a feature included in the embedded versions of Crowd as well.
fields.summary: Unable to Expire User Session From Admin Console

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing free text searches e.g. {code:sql}text ~ "example text"{code}, the performance of these kinds of search can be too slow and cause a timeout. The Interface will report these as:
{noformat}
an unknown error has occurred while trying to perform a search
{noformat}

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a text-only search on an instance with sufficiently many issues and fields.

h3. Expected Results
The search will complete in a timely manner

h3. Actual Results
The search takes a long time. in some cases, the following error will show in the UI:
{noformat}
an unknown error has occurred while trying to perform a search
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: performance improvement for free text searches

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching for issues using a "status" statements ("status was", "status =", "status changed"), the results are unreliable. This happens if there is a Next-gen project in the Jira's Cloud instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues using a "status was in/was not in (_status1_, _status2_) on _date_" argument;

h3. Expected Results
* All the issues that were on that statuses on that date returns as result of the query.

h3. Actual Results
* Some issues show in the result of the query. Other that also matches the argument, don't.

 !JRACLOUD-70797-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !JRACLOUD-70797-2.png|thumbnail! 

 !JRACLOUD-70797-3.png|thumbnail! 

*Update on April the 17th, 2020!*

This problem is very consistent on issues that are imported through a .CSV file and are on a different status than the query.

 !JRACLOUD-70797-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* Jira admins can leverage the REST API GET /rest/api/2/status against their Cloud instances to retrieve the ID of the statuses and then use it in JQL queries;
**  *Update on April the 17th, 2020!* The workaround above seems to not be working.
* To retrieve the ID of statuses used by *Classic* projects, Jira admins can also type the *g* key twice on their keyboard (gg) or, as alternative, their *period* key ( *.* ), then *Statuses*, hover the mouse over the "Edit" option on the relevant status and write down the number shown in the end of the URL.
* For details you can check: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/BUG-JQL-Unable-to-query-next-gen-project-s-issues-with-status/qaq-p/1319216#M67818
fields.summary: JQL query search using "status" returns incorrect unreliable results

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
New users isn't created when email sent from non-existing user using the "create user" option checkbox within the mail handler configuration. 

h3. *Steps to replicate*
# Go to JIRA > JIRA Settings > System > Incoming Mail or "GG" Incoming Mail
# Click "Add incoming mail handler" button to create new mail handler.
# Click Next
# Select "Create a new issue or add acomment" 
# Tick "Create Users" checkbox 
# Click Add

h3. *Actual Result*
User and issue isn't created

h3. *Expected Result*
Create new JIRA user and issue using the user's email as a username, subject and content. 

h3. *Workaround*
To allow Jira to handle email messages sent from people without a Jira user account:
# Create an anonymous or dummy mail account on your mail server.
# Create an equivalent anonymous or dummy Jira user account, whose email address matches the mail account you just created. 
# When configuring your mail handler options, set the Default Reporter to be the anonymous or dummy Jira user account.
fields.summary: Mail Handler isn't creating new user

fields.description:

Some texts in Jira and not translated into Danish.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the personal settings language to Danish.
# Open a Jira issue

h3. Expected Results

Texts in the Jira issue view should be displayed in Danish.

h3. Actual Results

Some texts are not translated into Danish.

 !danish.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incomplete Danish translation

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as Jira admin and set your language setting to anything other than English(ex. Japanese)
# View the detail of a workflow: statuses and transitions are shown in *English*
 !スクリーンショット 2018-10-15 11.11.11.png|thumbnail! 
# Check the statuses in the admin section: statuses are shown in *Japanese*
 !スクリーンショット 2018-10-15 11.15.37.png|thumbnail! 
# View an issue in the corresponding project: transitions are shown in *Japanese*
 !スクリーンショット 2018-10-15 11.11.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Problem Definition
There are no way for the admin to see which English status/transition is corresponding to which in Japanese, and vice versa. 
This is affecting the admin feature.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Show the items in the admin's preferred language in admin section
fields.summary: Translation inconsistency in Jira Admin feature affecting admin operation

fields.description: At the moment it seems as if the only way to keep formatting when updating a comment using the API is via wiki format. It would be nice to also allow HTML to be sent as the comment content. When retrieving a comment using the API you can specify the formatting (renderBody) to be HTML so having the same for POST request would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Allow HTML to be sent as comment update for API

Would be very helpful to be able to edit the message template to the customer would be able to mention all the channel. For example: @channel or @here
fields.summary: Ability to customize Slack message

fields.description:

# Log into the instance and go to *Backup Manager*
# Start a backup (for Server or Cloud, with or without attachments)

h3. Expected Results
The backup completes and you can download it as a zip file

h3. Actual Results
The backup process seems to get stuck on compressing data and attachments:
 !01-backup-stuck.jpg|thumbnail!  

The below exception is found in the logs:{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Export LRT task complete but no zip task found
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.backup.rest.ExportProgressHelper.lambda$zipper$0(ExportProgressHelper.java:45)
	at java.util.Optional.orElseThrow(Optional.java:290)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.backup.rest.ExportProgressHelper.zipper(ExportProgressHelper.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.backup.rest.CloudExportResource.getProgress(CloudExportResource.java:166)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor3168.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
...
{noformat}

 

h3.Workaround
No workaround available at the moment.

fields.description:

The space should now be disconnected on Jira

h3. Actual results

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently there is only 2-dimensional filter gadget in JIRA but there is no gadgets that are capable of supporting 3-dimensional uses cases. There is not much add-on on marketplace too that support this. Having a gadget that is capable of this will be helpful.
fields.summary: Adding three dimensional filter gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When deleting all the projects in the instance, the *Create Project* button does not work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new instance
 # Create a project
 # Delete the project
 # Click on *Projects* on the left panel, the *Create project* button does not work anymore, preventing users from creating any projects.

h3. Expected Results
 * User should be able to create a project.

h3. Actual Results
 * The button is not responsive.

h3. Workaround
* Use REST API to create the project. As long as there is a project in the instance, the *Create project* button will work.
* Refer to the [REST API Documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-project-post]
fields.summary: Can't create any projects after deleting all projects in the instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira cloud, database access is restricted from administrators. There are storage limit policies that needs to be met but the information on storage usage is not readily available to administrators

h3. Suggested Solution

Expose the following storage usage information to Jira administrators.

- Total Database Size
- Total Attachment Size
- Project Specific Database Size
- Project Specific Attachment Size


h3. Workaround 

Please reach out to Atlassian Support to request information on the site's data storage usage.
fields.summary: Admin information on Jira data storage usage in cloud

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently it is only possible to set the timezone in the user profile. It will be great if users are able to set their preferred time format similar to how 'Look and Feel' in JIRA is doing it; the only difference is that it is a personalized configuration instead of an instance wide configuration.
fields.summary: Ability to set personalized time format via user profile

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When updating date picker in issue split view, the issue icons appear over the calendar

Looks fine right before the calendar hits the top
 !Screenshot_335.png|thumbnail!  

Watch what happens when the calendar hits the top
!Screenshot_334.png|thumbnail! 

h2. How to reproduce
# Click on the Backlog.
# Click on an issue
# In the split view of the issue update the due date
# When calendar pops open, scroll down

h3. Expected behavior
The calendar should be hidden by the scroll view

h3. Actual results
The calendar appears ove the scroll view

h2. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: Issue split view Icons appear over the calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If there are too many options on the select list field, the scrollbar is not working as expected. Clicking on it would cause the scrollbar to disappear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a select list custom field with at least 9 options
# Assign it to a screen
# Go to the board
# Click on any issue
# Click on the custom field
# Click on the scrollbar
 !select.gif! 

h3. Expected Results
Able to scroll

h3. Actual Results
Scrollbar disappear

h3.Workaround
Open the issue in the new tab OR use the old JIRA view
fields.summary: Scroll bar on the select list (single choice) field disappear when there's too many options

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Please provide a public REST API for user management specifically:

# /user - PUT - to update display-name
# /user/activate - POST to activate a user
# /user/deactivate - POST to deactivate a user

Which supports API Token, OAuth, etc.

h3. Background

Currently vendor uses a private rest API {{/admin/rest/um/1}} to do their bidding and that they can do the same in server as well.
fields.summary: Provide public REST APIs for user management as in server

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Confluence Cloud in IE11
# Click the search icon from the sidebar
# Enter "テスト" and press return

h3. Expected Results
The search result will be displayed

h3. Actual Results
Following error will be shown
 !スクリーンショット 2018-10-11 9.25.03.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
* Use the search screen(Jira -> Issues and filters -> Search issues)
* Use a different browser
fields.summary: Jira returns 400 error when searching for double-byte chars in quick search in IE

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* As of now, users are only able to disable this feature from their profile after their account is created
* Admins would like to have a feature to flag this off during the user creation process

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a checkbox in the Invite User form to enable / disable JIRA Labs feature
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 08.02.56.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Why this is important
The old view shows pretty much every information needed in one place. Until the new issue view is fully implemented, admins would like to have the option to toggle it on or off 

h3. Workaround 
Have the user disable it from their profile after the account creation is successful
fields.summary: Allow site admins to disable JIRA Labs feature during User Creation

fields.description:
It would be very handy to be able to configure the editable fields in the "Link Issue" modal. That would allow for a more streamlined setup, so that we can configure the fields of the linked issue in a single location.

 - Reported by Fari Amirian
fields.summary: Allow for customization of the "Link Issue" dialogue box

fields.description:
When a user releases a fix version, the released version should be moved to the top of the list.

The reason why this is important is that the latestReleasedVersion() filter does not return results based on the end date, but rather the order your fix versions are sorted, and because latest means the top of the list then a released version by default should go to the top of the list, not the bottom.

The other option is creating a new filter for the earliest released version.

e.g. earliestReleasedVersion()
fields.summary: As a user, I want a released version to be moved to the top automatically

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On an iOS device, when the issue type of a JSD project issue is changed, the issue type changes correctly but the status of the issue does not change. This puts the issue in a very weird state as the current status of the issue is not part of the workflow of the new issue type.
h3. Environment

iOS
Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * From the Jira app on iOS login and access the JSD project.
 * Change the issue type for an issue in the JSD project.
 * The issue type will change successfully but the issue status will not change.
 * The same can be confirmed by logging into the instance from the browser.
 * Basically, the issue status will not match the issue type workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The change in the issue type of a JSD issue from an iOS device should also change the issue status(or at least an option to select the right status)
h3. Actual Results

The change in the issue type of a JSD issue from an iOS device is not changing its status.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: On a iOS device,moving the issue type for a JSD project issue is not changing the status

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you're editing a notification scheme, JIRA allows you to select Service Desk portal-only users in the *single user* picker, and when you try to save, an error 500 is presented.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Service Desk 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the project settings > Notifications
# Click on Actions > Edit Notifications
# Click on Add (any event type)
# In the single-user field, start typing a name that matches a JSD portal-only user username
# Try to add the new notification with the portal-only user selected

h3. Expected Results

An error should be presented stating that portal-only users cannot receive JIRA notifications. Or, they should not even be presented in this user-picker field.

h3. Actual Results

An error 500 message is presented. This gives the idea that something is wrong in JIRA when in fact this could not be possible to be made by the customer.
fields.summary: Notification scheme shows an error 500 when you add a JSD portal-only user as recipient

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you're in the *Notification Scheme* association page, from within a project, and click on Cancel, the URL is incorrect and missing the project key. An error is presented stating that the project 'notifications' does not exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the project settings > Notifications
# Click on Actions > Use a different scheme
# Click on Cancel

h3. Expected Results

The system redirects you to the notification scheme page

h3. Actual Results

The project key is missing from the URL that the Cancel link redirects, so an error is presented because the system redirects you to an invalid page.
 
h3.Workaround

Manually go back to the notification scheme page by using the browser navigation.
fields.summary: Incorrect URL when clicking on Cancel within notification scheme association

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, when an user clicks "restore defaults" (on purpose or by accident) while selecting columns in the list view of issues, Jira defaults to its own set of columns.

 !Columns.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to set their own default of columns, if the "restore defaults" link is clicked.

h3. Why this is important
Enhance the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
There are none.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to define which columns are the default when I click "restore defaults"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to view the full status name from the view screen in the new issue view. If the status name is long only a part of it is visible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to view the full status name from the view screen in the new issue view when the cursor is hovered.

h3. Why this is important
Customers with long status names need to see the full name when the cursor is hovered over. Only a part of it is visible which causes confusion with other status' beginning with the word(s).
fields.summary: Full status name cannot be seen when the cursor is hovered over the status name in new issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to view the full workflow from the view screen in the new issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to view the full workflow from the view screen in the new issue view.

h3. Why this is important
Customer with elongated workflows need to know which status' are present in the full workflow.
fields.summary: View workflow link not available in new issue view

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to set what fields are displaying in what screen section. 
 Right now (in the new UI) only description and comments are displaying in the main section of the issue.

For example: 

I've created custom field for Bug Details, 

I'd like to have it in the main section of the screen, not in the site panel on the right. 

!image-2018-10-10-13-11-47-999.png!
fields.summary: As an admin I'd like to configure what fields are diplaying on specific screen section

fields.description:
h3.  Problem Definition

In the new Jira issue view, it's not possible to have the date time picker display time in 24hour notation, i.e. 8:30 PM instead of 20:30.
||old issue view||new issue view||
|​ !Screen Shot 2018-10-09 at 8.31.44 PM.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2018-10-09 at 8.41.24 PM.png|thumbnail! ​|
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow the date/time picker to display time in 24hour notation instead of 12hour

h3. Why this is important
 * It was possible in the old issue view
 * Some customers prefer to work in 24hour time

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds
fields.summary: New issue view: 24hour time in date/time picker

At the time of writing, characters aren't being rendered properly when the language preference of a user is set to:
 * íslenska (Ísland)

 # Navigate to {{https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa}}
 # Change the language setting to one that is mentioned in the "Summary", e.g. "íslenska (Ísland)" of this issue
 # Confirm/save changes

h3. Expected Results
 * All the characters are rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
||Dansk (Danmark)||íslenska (Ísland)||

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update—30 July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
The fix for this has now been rolled out to 100% of production users and every instance should now see the opsbar-sequence property honoured in transition ordering in the new issue view.

The approach we have taken will only affect the ordering of transitions within the new issue view. Nothing will change in the old issue view. The ordering logic is as follows:
 * Always show transitions with the opsbar-sequence property first according to their opsbar-sequence value (lower values appear first)
 * Then show remaining transitions ordered first by category (Todo, In Progress, Done)
 * Within category order alphabetically by name of the status being transitioned to

Thank you all for your support and patience as we worked on this. Please don't be afraid to share any stories or workflow improvements that this allows so that they can be fed back to the team.
{panel}
h3. Summary

opsbar-sequence property doesn't sequence transitions in corrent order in new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple transitions from a status to other status'.
 # Add opsbar-sequence property to each of the transtions and provide *value* based on how you want to order it.
 # Checking in old issue view - the transitions are ordered as they are set in properties. On the contrary, the transitions do not follow the order as set in properties for the transitions.

h3. Expected Results

Transitions should be in proper sequence as set in workflow properties in the new issue view.
h3. Actual Results

Transtions do not appear in proper sequence. It does not follow the sequence as it is mentioned in opsbar-seqeunce property.
h3. Workaround

No Workaround.
fields.summary: opsbar-sequence property does not work in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

There are 2 scenarios that are most commonly experienced by users:
 # When issues are marked as Complete (as a result of issue being moved to the right most column), moving this column to other position/place will *Not* undo the changes in Resolution field. Issues are still marked as "Complete"
 # For issues that are inactive for 14 days in the right most column will disappear. However, adding a new column and place it in the right most column will *not* undo this. All the issues are still hidden until users make any updates.
 ** See this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17113

h3. Suggested Resolution

Improve the experience of Agility board to reflect the changes of adding/moving new column. In the mean time, please update the docs to reflect the above scenarios.
fields.summary: Improvement for Agility board when new column added

fields.description:
When managing dashboards from the "All Dashboards", if you delete a dashboard, the process will redirect the user to a delete dashboard page. As a consequence of this, the filtering that the user had previously set will be lost as a result. This can negatively impact the user experience, particularly when the user is trying to manage many Dashboards.

I would like to suggest that the filtering be preserved when redirected back to the "All Dashboards" page.
fields.summary: Deleting a Dashboard clears the filter on all dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

New issue view for Jira Software Cloud cannot display messages containing quoted thumbnails
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Turn off the new issue view in your personal settings
 # Find a Jira Software issue with an existing image attachment
 # Comment to that Jira issue with a content of
{noformat}
 {quote} !filename.png|thumbnail! {quote} {noformat}

 # Confirm image appears in the comment as a quoted message
 # return to your personal settings/profile and re-enable the new issue view
 # refresh the Jira issue

h3. Expected Results

Comment shows up as expected, with quoted text that contains an image/thumbnail
h3. Actual Results

Comment does not show any content at all, including missing unquoted text.
 When looking that the browser console you can see an error of:
{code:java}
RangeError: Invalid content for node blockquote
    at K.createChecked (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-fabric-renderer.9ee52142d83cf36e3350.7.js:1)
    at t.b (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)

    at t.n.getAdfFromHtml (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the New Issue view, when one wants to adjust the Start date and time, the only time interval available is between 9am and 6pm

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud
* New Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any issue in the new issue view.
# Attempt to log time.
# Attempt to edit the Date started by clicking the calendar sign next to it
Notice the time picker only shows the 9am - 6pm time interval

# Expected Results
The time picker should show a whole day time interval

h3. Actual Results
The time picker only shows 9am - 6pm, in 30 minutes increments

h3. Workaround
There are currently 2 workarounds:
# Disable New Jira issue view under *Profile → Labs* section. This will bring the old issue view with another date/time picker
fields.summary: Change option to Log Time in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue description
As a user, I'd like when deleting an issue from backlog to keep at the project page.
However, if I delete an issue by clicking on it > *(...)* > Delete, the page will ask for the confirmation and redirects to the issue navigator instead of keeping me at the project page.

h3. Reproducing the issue
https://cl.ly/90eda7b69541

h3. Expected results
The page should return me to the project page instead of issue navigator.

h3. Actual results
The page redirects me to the issue navigator page and I have to navigate back to the project.

h3. Workaround
Use right-clicking at the issue to delete it instead of more *(...)* menu.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like when deleting an issue from backlog to keep at the project page

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The sprint burndown gadget gadget won't load in the dashboard. It won't be possible to edit it either (when clicking on the ellipses button, the edit option will not be displayed). 
When click to *view as wallboard*, the gadget will be displayed as blank:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-08 at 09.41.23.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-10-08 at 09.49.18.png|thumbnail! 

The sprint health gadget does work properly in the dashboard view, but when viewing in wallboard, it will behave the same way as the burndown gadget:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-08 at 09.55.45.png|thumbnail! 

In both cases (including the dashboard view), the same error is triggered in the browser console:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-08 at 09.39.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud (IE11).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In your dashboard, click on *Add gadget* -> select the sprint burndown gadget;
# Do the same as the previous step, but select the sprint health gadget;
# Notice in the dashboard view that the sprint burndown gadget will not load;
# Click on the ellipses button (dashboard) -> *View as wallboard*;
# Both the sprint health gadget and the burndown gadget will be displayed as blank squares;
# Other gadgets will work though.

h3. Expected Results

Both gadgets would load their content in both the dashboard view and the wallboard view.

h3. Actual Results

The Sprint burndown gadget won't work in neither the dashboard view, nor in the wallboard view.
The Sprint health gadget won't work in the wallboard view.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Sprint burndown and Sprint health gadget not working properly in IE11

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Work is currently in progress to improve the utility of the attachment cards in Jira. As part of these changes we will add a button to all attachment cards to directly download the attachment. We expect these changes to be delivered to you in the next month.

Note that in addition to improved attachment cards we are also actively working on bringing a list view to Jira's new issue view. This will provide an alternative way for you to find your attachments and will also include the ability to directly download an attachment: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70146

Kind regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
Using the old issue view, when you click in the attachment using the key *Command* the file is downloaded automatically, however, this feature is not available in the new issue view.

It's important because sometimes the user just needs to download the file and don't want to wait for the loading of the preview.

A button to download the single file under the thumbnail of the attachment would also help in this situation.

{panel:title=Update 22 Nov 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}
For big attachment files (over 8 MB) a Cloud icon is appears on the file allowing you to download it without having to preview the file. However, this is only applicable for Excel files.

 !TEST_-_Queues_-_Service_Desk.png|thumbnail! 

{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to download an attachment without opening the preview in the new issue view.

h3. Why this is important
Such functionality would improve the usability of the Slack integration by providing more options to keep track of issues using the Slack rooms since we lots of rooms and projects.

In the updated navigation left sidebar, when a Jira admin is administering a Service Desk project, the "KB Hub", "Customer Channels" and "Invite Team" buttons are bugged, showing the code of the button instead of the button itself. Also, the button doesn't work.

# Type the *g* key twice on your keyboard (gg) or, as alternative, your *period* key ( *.* ), then *Projects*;

Jira Cloud.

h3. Summary
In the updated navigation left sidebar, if a Jira admin doesn't have the "Browse Projects" permission on a specific project, the project's settings becames unavailable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Pre req 1: Be sure your instance is using the updated navigation left sidebar;
 !updated navigation left sidebar.png|thumbnail! 
# Pre req 2: Be a Jira admin of that instance;
# Find a project you *don't* have the "Browse Projects" permission on;
# Click the ellipsis (*. . .*), then *Project settings*.

h3. Expected Results
* Even without the "Browse Projects" permission on that specific project, the Jira admin should be able to view its settings.

 !With browse projects.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Without the "Browse Projects" permission on that specific project, the Jira admin can't access its settings (it is still possible through URL tinkering, though)

 !Without browse projects.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)

* Jira Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try generating a new Jira backup, can be for Server or Cloud, with or without attachments

h3. Expected Results

Backup is generated

h3. Actual Results

The following is seen in UI:

{quote}
Export error

Export failed (preparation)

Please try again later or contact support if error persists.
{quote}

h3.Workaround

In a Jira Service Desk project, ensure you have a holiday defined in one of your SLA Calendars. This will allow you to generate a Jira backup.

fields.description:
When attempting to upload files using /rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/attachments the speed is extremely slow often in the 1Mb/s range. This causes the uploads of larger files (700MB - 2GB) to be too slow to complete without timeouts causing some integrations to break.

Given that the maximum supported file size for attachments in cloud is 2GB, the speed should be sufficiently high or the timeouts should be sufficiently long so as not to cause the upload to fail on a consistent basis.

I would like to recommend that the speed be increased to at least 3Mbps.
fields.summary: Increase upload speeds for /rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/attachments

fields.description:
This feature suggestion is to implement a new permission for "Change Issue type" in JIRA which will allow JIRA administrators to prevent users from changing issue types when moving issues between projects, or when performing bulk updates etc.

Use case:

Changing issue types can lead to various consequences and impact JIRA add-ons which are dependant on this field.

In Jira Portfolio pans for example, when changes are done to items that are on JIRA Portfolio plans -- these items just disappear from the plans

Having an ability to restrict users from changing issue type would prevent this situation and would allow more flexibility to configure JIRA permissions
fields.summary: Change Issue type permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Issue move event notification is only triggered when Issue is moved into or out of a project. The customer wants to be alerted when the Issue type is changed within the same project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a notification event when the Issue type is changed.

h3. Why this is important
Important to track if any Issue type is changed in a project.
 
h3. Workaround 
Issue updated event sends out the alert but it will also send out notifications when any details in the issue is changed including the deletion of an issue comment.
fields.summary: Trigger Issue Move event notification when the Issue type is changed within the same project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is possible to check through the Jira issue view, messages in Slack where the specific issue was mentioned.

Also, currently, it is possible to check through the Jira issue view, messages in Hipchat where the specific issue was mentioned.

When migrating my data from Hipchat rooms to Slack channels I still want to see the information on where the Jira issue is mentioned.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * a tool to convert all the links between Jira tickets and HipChat rooms to links to Slack channels

h3. Why this is important
 * I don't want to lose the visibility of my Jira issues and their link to Slack channels.

h3. Workaround
 * Currently, there is no workaround.
 * Currently, it is possible to [migrate data from Hipchat to Slack|https://www.atlassian.com/partnerships/slack/migration] but there is no workaround to keep track of Jira issues mentions after the migration.
 * User can get in touch with another third party app such as [slack-connector|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214122/slack-connector?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] and verify if they do consider supporting this.
fields.summary: I want a tool to convert all the links between Jira tickets and HipChat rooms to links to Slack channels.

Instead of having to make sure the developer on each ticket is aware of any updates/changes or remembering to go back to the story that has been completed. It would also help QA testing.
fields.summary: Continuous syncing JIRA stories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create comments from the mobile app, then restrict them, When using the new issue view in the Russian language, you will see the comments replaced by a number of restriction locks.

h3. Environment
Cloud (Old Issue View)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a comment in an issue using the mobile platform
# Edit the issue so that you can restrict the comment to a specific group
# change to Russian language and view the issue
# Change to the old issue view if needed

h3. Expected Results
The Comment is displayed as expected


h3. Actual Results
 !Example of issue.png|thumbnail! 
As you can see, the comment is replaced by grey locks.
 

h3.Workaround
This issue only appears if all of the following factors are met:
- The comment was created from the mobile app
- The comment is restricted
- You are viewing the issue in the Old issue view
- You are viewing the issue in Russian

If you can prevent or change any of those factors, you will not see this issue.
fields.summary: Comments from mobile that are restricted show padlocks in place of the comment in Russian in Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Customized email notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2016/09/customize-the-notifications-you-send-to-your-customers] is a feature that is available for Jira Service Desk projects and not for Jira Core and Software.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow customizations of Emails in Jira Core and Software.
h3. Why this is important

There are use cases where additional information can be provided on event notifications.

 
h3. Workaround

You can use *Project Automation* to customize notifications (you may want to disable the default Jira notifications that you are going to replace with the custom ones).

You can find the *Project Automation* voice at the bottom of your project settings. Be careful not to confuse it with the Jira Service Desk *Automation* voice present in the same menu (in case of Jira Service Desk projects).

For further details on this please see:
 * [Jira Automation|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/features/automation]
 * [Automate your Jira Cloud processes and workflows|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automate-your-jira-cloud-processes-and-workflows/]
fields.summary: Allow customized emails for the notifications in Jira.

fields.description:
According to [Advanced searching - functions reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-765593719.html]:
{quote}
For the startOfWeek() function the result depends upon your locale.  For example, in Europe the first day 
of the week is generally considered to be Monday, while in the USA it is considered to be Sunday.
{quote}

But, seem not the case where only able to search start on Sunday issue.
h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Create issues in a project on Sunday and on Monday
# Change the *time zone* in the *personal profile* to Europe and GMT+1 or GMT+2.
# Change the *Default users' time zone* in the Jira Settings > Systems > *General Configuration*.
# In the *Look and feel* section, enable *Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker* in the Date/time formats.
# Look for issues created after startOfWeek().
# The issues that were created on Sunday and Monday will be displayed and not just after Monday.

Please investigate on what factor determines the Locale of the instance, as modifying the time zones in the Personal Profile and the General configuration does not bring about any changes in the search results.
fields.summary: startofweek() jql function doesn't reflect system locale

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you associate a project with an [Issue Security Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html], JIRA will stop sending notifications to Slack.  
* Reference: [Why am I not receiving notifications for certain Jira Cloud projects or issues?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/jira-cloud-for-slack-950819031.html]

This behavior is intended in order to avoid any sensitive data for being shared on a Slack room without having the previous consent of a JIRA administrator. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* As a JIRA administrator, I'd like to have a way on the integration UI to approve the sharing of this content on a specific Slack channel of my choice. 

h3. Workaround 
* Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA for Slack integration: Make it possible to receive notifications from issues secured by issue security schemes
